casebody.data:
No. 46—2316.Crane Brothers’ Manufacturing Company v. Kraft, Gross & Company.In this case there were three issues of fact: Whether the appellant made the contract sued on, whether there was a breach and what were the damages. The case was tried by'the court without a jury, and while there was a conflict of evidence on some points, an examination of the record satisfies the court that the findings of the trial court were correct.Affirmed.

Judge below, Joseph E. Gaby.

Attorneys, for appellant, Mr. B. L. Tatham ;for appellee, Mr. W. W. Gurley.Opinion filed April 28, 1886.

Opinion Per Curiam.
